formattedAddress: 217 E 3rd St, New York, NY 10009, USA
adrFormatAddress: 217 E 3rd St, New York, NY 10009, USA

editorialSummary.text: Gourmet American eats & cocktails in a narrow, stylish space with a whitewashed bar & painted brick.

originalText.text:
Have been going here for years. The owner and staff are very sweet. Great local East Village spot for the best biscuits in NY with a nice outdoor space. If you are vegetarian/vegan, the mushroom gravy is amazing but a little heavy. Love their salads and homemade hot sauce.

For dinner, the atmosphere is very cozy and they have a nice wine selection, risotto and grilled salmon

originalText.text:
This restaurant is quite busy, so be prepared to wait. We had a reservation and were seated on time, but it took about 45 minutes for our food to arrive. The atmosphere is charming, rustic outdoor seating area, with a laidback vibe.

I ordered the "Post breakfast" with a homemade biscuit on the side. It was tasty, but nothing particularly extraordinary. My fianc√© ordered the Huevos Rancheros with a cold coffee. The coffee was quite disappointing, I'd rate it a 5/10. The service was good, and the server made me a delightful pink soda drink.

originalText.text:
GUESS‚Ä¶ what I had? üòÆ During a recent visit to POST in NYC, I had the pleasure of experiencing one of the most delightful dining experiences I've had in a long time. From the moment we walked in until the time we left, everything about our visit was outstanding.

First and foremost, our waiter ‚ÄúDAN‚Äù  deserves all the praise in the world. Not only was he extremely attentive, but his friendliness and genuine warmth truly elevated the dining experience. He made us feel welcome from the start and took the time to answer all our questions about the menu with a smile, suggesting some delightful options we wouldn't have tried otherwise. His service was impeccable, and he struck the perfect balance between being attentive without being intrusive.

Now, let's talk about the food ‚Äì it was nothing short of phenomenal. Every dish we ordered was a delightful masterpiece of flavors, textures, and presentation. The menu offered a diverse selection of dishes. Each dish was crafted with care and attention to detail.

One dish that stood out was the Vegan üå± dishes my group of 5ive ordered as well as our non vegan dishes, which was an explosion of flavors that left our taste buds dancing with delight. The ingredients were fresh and thoughtfully combined, resulting in a truly memorable experience. The portions were generous, satisfying our appetites.

Our alcoholic drinks was wonderful, the selection was impressive, and we couldn't resist trying the Post Sunrise w/tequila. It was the perfect sweet ending to an already fantastic meal, and we savored every last bite.

The ambiance of the restaurant was also noteworthy, as it struck the right balance between upscale and cozy. The decor was tasteful, and the atmosphere was relaxed with music, making it an ideal place for a special occasion or a casual dinner with my family.

POST Restaurant in NYC was nothing short of exceptional. The combination of a friendly and attentive waiter along with the outstanding food made for a memorable dining adventure. If you're in search of a place that excels in both service and culinary artistry, this restaurant should be at the top of your list. I cannot recommend it enough, and I'm already looking forward to my next visit.

originalText.text: I‚Äôm absolutely obsessed with POST! It is quite the gem. The food is always delicious. The favors are simply magical and unique. The staff is charming and attentive, they really make you feel at home.  & Mike (the owner) is beyond beautiful, he gives his all to make sure you have a wonderful experience every single time. I highly recommend you try out everything & anything. You won‚Äôt be disappointed! P.S. try their in house hot sauce & biscuits (it‚Äôs life changing!) :)

originalText.text: Very nice cozy place in the east village. Large meal portions that you can share. Pancakes are amazing! Bon Merde sauce is great as well. Cortado and cappuccino seemed to be same size, ask for a mug if you want a bigger size.

text.text: Very nice cozy place in the east village. Large meal portions that you can share. Pancakes are amazing! Bon Merde sauce is great as well. Cortado and cappuccino seemed to be same size, ask for a mug if you want a bigger size.
